column5: does anyone have the install manual? i have the operations manual but nothing for the installation. the website does not have anything but the operations manuals to download. its pretty straight forward but im somewhat boggled on the mounting hardware,seems like id be drilling unnessesary holes for the bracket.
Would youtube have a diy video?
oops theres no ci. just di
i did a quick check earlier and didnt see anything

The install is straight forward but what issues do your foresee having? I just installed a 561 on the bow of my boat and a 788 on my dads console. If I remember correctly, I pre drilled 4 holes for the base mount on the dash and now and 2 holes for the transducer in my dads. I think one would do on the transducer but I would prefer not to mess with their recommendations.

You really don't need installation instructions..  Can't mess up any of the wires because the ends are all different and only fit one way in the locking mechanism that installs into the base..  Super simple.

You really don't need installation instructions..  Can't mess up any of the wires because the ends are all different and only fit one way in the locking mechanism that installs into the base..  Super simple.

its the brackets for the transducer, the top peice has the average 2 screws then theres a 3rd screw for the bracket thats apart of the transducer that requires one screw. by usuing that one screw that whole other peice seems useless

Do you have the proper kit to install the transducer?  After looking at the Humminbird website, it looks like you need MHX XNT.  http://ca.humminbird.com/products/460925?product_id=e76c174b6c9a0ca4df401e63f9b47865

The third hole is to be used if you want to LOCK your transducer down and not have the capabality to allow it to free float while loading or driving.  I have the 597 model and will check the box for the install instructions, as I just installed it this spring.  Checked and I do have install booklet

yep thats the bracket i have.  am i supposed to have just the one transducer? i bought a display model so just want to make sure i got everything.ive only ever owned one finder before this  and it was very basic and no DI
